41.heading: Ferrying.

41.author: Eleuteri-Serpieri, Ambrosio.

(Stories of the West ; 1)

Summary: A wagonload of women volunteers is being taken to Raton as prospective brides. Three women become acquainted: a schoolteacher, a saloon girl, and the daughter of a rich man. The men who are ferrying them become unpleasant and violent on the way, and the women continue alone leaving them dead.

45.heading: Ferstadt, Louis, 1900-1954.
45.title: All Star Comics Archives. v. 3
45.author: foreword by Roy Thomas.
notes: (DC Archive Editions)
Collects the Justice Society and Hop Harrigan stories from All Star Comics #11-14 (1942-1943).

Stories in this collection were written by Gardner Fox and Sheldon Mayer, and drawn by Jack Burnley, Sheldon Moldoff, Harry G. Peter, Cliff Young, Ben Flinton, Howard Sherman, Stan Asch, Bernard Klein, Bernard Baily, Joe Gallagher, Lou Ferstadt, Pierce Rice, Jack Kirby, Joe Simon, and Howard Ferguson. Editors are Sheldon Mayer and Ted Udall. Brief biographies are presented at the end of the volume.

notes: "2001 Festival of Cartoon Art."

"This catalogue is published as part of the 2001 Festival of Carton Art to accompany the exhibition Historic Virtuoso Cartoonists from August 26 through September 30, 2001 at the Columbus Recreation and Parks Department Cultural Arts Center."

Biographical sketches of Thomas Nast, Joseph Keppler, Frederick Burr Opper, Richard Felton Outcault, Winsor McCay, Nell Brinkley, George Herriman, Edwina Dumm, Rube Goldberg, Milton Caniff, Walt Kelly, Charles M. Schulz, Willard Mullin, James Thurber, Oliver Harrington, Art Young, Jay 'Ding' Darling, Rollin Kirby, and Jeff MacNelly.

Brief essays on cartoon virtuosity, with contributor notes for each, by Shelly Armitage, Kenneth Stacey Baker, Daniel Bolsinger, John Canemaker, N.C. Christopher Couch, Bill Crouch, Will Eisner, Roger A. Fischer, Thierry Groensteen, R.C. Harvey, M. Thomas Inge, Jim Ivey, Michael Kahn, Gene Kannenberg Jr., Amy Lago, John A. Lent, Jack Loftis, Patrick McDonnell, Toni Mendez, Roy Paul Nelson, Richard D. 155.heading: Festivities.
155.title: "Salammbo"
155.author: by Philippe Druillet ; adapted from the original by Gustave Flaubert
155.appears_in: p. 36-51 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 12 (Mar. 1981).
notes: Begins: "On the anniversary of the Eryx battle, the council held a huge banquet for the troops who had fought in that war. During the festivities, Salammbo, the daughter of Hamilcar, appeared. She was lovely; swirls of incense surrounded her as she spoke to the men and captivated each and every one of them, especially two. Of these, one was Narr'Havas, a Numidian prince; the other, a nameless yet legendary tribal leader."
